# NON-Modifiable Third-Party Regulations
You are encouraged to recover any third-party personnel found in the [bold]Area of Operations[/bold] that are unable to fend for themselves.
## General
- All recovered persons must be searched on arrival by personnel, with all weapons and unauthorized items secured within the armory. - They should be given a medical examination if personnel are available. - Recovered personnel have the right to remain silent and must not be punished for invoking it.
## Military and Paramilitary
- Third-party military or paramilitary personnel may be allowed to continue their operations if they prove beneficial or indifferent to faction interests. (This is also located in the [bold]Rules of Engagement[/bold]) - They may be given permission to keep their weapons and equipment on the warship or in the base, provided they are beneficial to the operation. - They may also be denied access to the warship or base.
## Returning to the AO
- Recovered Personnel may deploy back to the [bold]Area of Operations[/bold] and request their equipment be returned. Personnel must, however, escort them back to the dropship to ensure they deploy. - Returning from this deployment requires another search, but medical examinations may be skipped.
## Eviction
Recovered personnel may be evicted and denied access to the ship or base by the [color=#00CBFE][bold]Commander[/bold][/color]. - Recovered personnel may be evicted if they commit any major crime.
